channel.title: Aston Martin One-77
channel.description:
Aston Martin will reveal the first working concept of its £1 million One-77 supercar to the world today.
[img]http://estb.msn.com/i/2E/F7484BE3D3C80ED62D44981F371A8.jpg[/img]
The covers will be pulled off the concept at the exclusive Concorso d'Eleganza show in Italy.
This marks the first time the new Aston Martin has been seen in public. Aston Martin describes the show car as a fully-complete concept, which we're sure will closely mirror the ultra-exclusive production car.
Billed by Aston Martin as the 'definitive sports car', there is no denying it's dramatic. It's an Aston Martin on steroids, with impossibly pumped bodywork and taut, bulging wheelarches. Looking ready to pounce, the drama alone is sure to fully justify the immense price tag for a very lucky few. Indeed, just 77 of them.
Aston Martin has also opened up the doors of the One-77. This gives us a first peek at the interior - and it looks like it's pretty bespoke to MSN Cars' eyes. No missing that huge, stylised air vent, nor the use of cutting-edge, modern materials. Exposed construction structures also hint at latest-generation underpinnings. Aston Martin One-77 (Image © Aston Martin)
Speaking of the new motor, Aston Martin boss, Dr Ulrich Bez, said: 'The One-77 demonstrates the unique capabilities of our company - it encompasses engineering excellence with a great passion from our engineers, designers and technical partners. This is a major step in One-77's engineering programme.'
In showing the very first complete car, Dr. Bez says Aston Martin is demonstrating 'new benchmarks in many different fields of automotive design. The craftsmanship and design that has gone into the creation of the Aston Martin One-77 lifts automotive engineering into the realm of art. It surpasses any Aston Martin that has gone before it.'
'With its finely sculpted forms and sleek lines, it is an expression of unparalleled beauty that embodies everything Aston Martin stands for.' Which sure sounds like a call to arms for us. This genuinely is an exciting supercar announcement, and a super-significant new car that could, just maybe, set new supercar benchmarks.
[b]In Short... Its Bloody Sexy![/b]
Sause: http://cars.uk.msn.com/News/car_news_article.aspx?cp-documentid=16331472&ocid=today

item.title: Aston Martin One-77
item.dc:creator: @Cheese_Police c|p
item.description:
@Cheese_Police wrote:

The car itself isn’t too bad.

I feel as if it looks bad with the spoiler, but it looks worse without it.

Read full topic

item.title: Aston Martin One-77
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:275715”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=364194.msg2765379#msg2765379 date=1240771152]

If by sexy you mean butt-ass ugly then I fully agree with you. I wouldn’t pay $20,000 for a car that looks like that.

no taste what so ever
its a beautiful car, the curves and the sharpness of that front quarter panel are amazing, however on a more important note: do aston martin even know about the economic down turn?
[/quote]

This is a beautiful car:

And I’d pay the $200,000 price for it too if I had that kind of money :P[/quote]

I’ve seen disabled children draw better looking cars o_0

Seriously that spoiler is ghastly.

Read full topic

item.title: Aston Martin One-77
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Elijah:

I love the Lamborghini Reventon. It’s actually the world’s most expensive car. It costs $2.2 million USD. People assume the Bugatti Veyron is the world’s most expensive car. But it’s not, it’s the world’s most expensive production car.

The Bugatti Veyron is probably the most expenisive production car to produce but strangely they sell it to the customer at a huge loss. The Car itself costs around £5 million of produce but is only flogged for ~£800,000. It was a technical exercise.

Read full topic

item.title: Aston Martin One-77
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

[quote=“Elijah, post:13, topic:275715”]This car is so much better:

That or the Lamborghini Gallardo LP560-4 in white.

[/quote]

Are you serious? The 1st car looks like an overgrown toy car in my perspective, especially the front and back parts of the car.

The white Lamborghini Gallardo LP560 - 4 on the other hand looks great.

Read full topic
